title: Bizoran
author: Bizoran
content: It's my opinion that if anyone give more time in this forum then he/she easily go up. He/she can easily get all types of information from here. I personally like this forum because i get all types of knowledge here. Different different sec section have different information. As a Newbie i want to spend more and more time in this forum to gain more and more information for my intelligence. Now i want to get more and more information how to improve my poor English writing /speaking

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Bitcointalk is honestly overrated in terms of learning in general. It's great for having questions and discuss/debate certain news and topics, but if you're a beginner you're better off reading articles off the web.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMNow i want to get more and more information how to improve my poor English writing /speaking  Sorry that is not what bitcointalk is about, it is not like a college where you can learn how to write and speak English, it is a discussion forum, and truly the language used for communicating in bitcointalk is English (except the local boards), and there are many native speakers of the language here, you can learn a little from how they write.Needless to say that it isn't enough, and the better thing to do is to improve your English writing and speaking off the forum, there are websites you can take English courses for some months, you can also install Grammarly to assist you too, as well as many other tools out there to learn English properly. Bitcointalk is a bitcoin discussion forum, take it to be that.

Bitcointalk is a bitcoin discussion forum, take it to be that.Exactly i know that it's not like a school or College.  I just want information that you give me in your last three line.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:57:07 AMSo you want to say that web is better than this forum. But can i get specific knowledge from web which i want?Yes, you can simply use Google for like 90% of the information concerning Bitcoin/crypto. The 10% minority, mostly the more technical questions, you can ask Bitcointalk.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMNow i want to get more and more information how to improve my poor English writing /speaking  Information and knowledge are just here on forum you can freely scan all the topics you wanted to learn and browse here and anything about bitcoin.  You can also use the search function for easy navigation and roaming around here and finding useful topics.Improving english writing and speaking are need of practice and studying which i believe you could practice for yourself.  You can use some learning on internet Youtube has plenty of resources.

comments.author: Munir575
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on August 29, 2022, 07:45:40 AMIt's great for having questions and discuss/debate certain news and topics, but if you're a beginner you're better off reading articles off the web.You must at least have a basic knowledge of the subject as a beginner in order to participate in conversations and understand the answers to your questions. So you can see that reading books and articles online is the greatest place to start.You gain a better understanding of what you study when you participate in discussions.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMNow i want to get more and more information how to improve my poor English writing /speaking  A Forum user, Jet Cash, used to run a program designed for non native speakers; Fit to Talk Project. I say 'used to' cause I'm not certain how active it is at this time.Quote from: mk4 on August 29, 2022, 07:45:40 AMBitcointalk is honestly overrated in terms of learning in general. It's great for having questions and discuss/debate certain news and topics, but if you're a beginner you're better off reading articles off the web.I have many issues learning off articles, for one, you get a one sided opinion, from the writer. This is different from a discussion, where users can correct and add to already said points. Also, articles are not usually updated, and search engines are more likely to bring out older ones, with more engagements than newer ones, hence, there could be a gap in knowledge.Learning how to use the search option effectively can unlock so many ways beginners can learn from the forum.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMAs a Newbie i want to spend more and more time in this forum to gain more and more information for my intelligence. If you haven't already, I suggest you familiarize yourself with the rules of the forum, because it is something that will help you better understand how the forum works, which will be good for you and all the other members of the forum. One of the rules says: "Posting multiple posts in a row (excluding bumps and reserved posts by the thread starter) is not allowed". You can read more about all the rules here -> Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQRegarding the forum and the time you want to spend here, my personal opinion is that it is definitely time well spent, especially if you want to study what happened throughout the history of Bitcoin through various discussions of forum members. Although I have officially been on the forum since mid-2015, I often find some interesting information that I did not know about before. Of course, the forum is not the only place where you can find information, but it is certainly a much better place than various social networks ruled by various so-called crypto experts and scammers.

comments.author: Anguwa

To some of us, this forum is more than a school; we can learn many things without spending any money; all we need is our time and dedication; with enough time and dedication, one can learn as much as he or she can.QuoteNow i want to get more and more information how to improve my poor English writing /speaking  You can also improve your writing style by reading many users' writeups here; some users are very good writers, so if you can read most users' sentence structures, I believe it will help you improve.You can also install Grammary on your computer to help you structure your sentences.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Engagement into this community brings rapid development to any user. When you observe very well it's noticable that any user who is not desperate in making money from the community actually ressurect fast in any ramifications. And another thing we have to understand concerning this forum is that we have to know that this place is fully made up of diversification of knowledge. Being consistent in research of anything concerning Bitcoin do accelerate unexpectedly.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: I do not agree that reading web articles gets you more knowledge than spending your time on this forum does.  Simply because by communicating and letting others correct you, you are automatically entering a phase of learning.  You barely ever get to say some B S and get away with it here, there will almost definitely at some point be someone out here to correct you.  Articles are often paid, some of them do not even properly define what Bitcoin is or what Cryptocurrencies are.  Furthermore.  You get a TON of articles about Shitcoins 'that are about to explode or replace Bitcoin' which has always been disproved by the test of time.Spend your time here if you like it, and you will automatically learn a lot.-Regards,PrivacyG

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Not all knowledge gotten from forum can be considered valuable, considering that there as still some discussions featured in some boards that hold little or no benefit/relevance to any reader. Some discussions are just regular discussions.  Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMIt's my opinion that if anyone give more time in this forum then he/she easily go up.True that you can learn a thing or two from this forum, but do not completely depend on forum alone for updated knowledge. The forum should not be seen as a substitute for following up on news, reading articles and publication etc. but as a plus to it.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: Learning does not have to be on the bitcointalk forum because there are still many out there that are better about the knowledge that we must learn including from articles and other websites that are more important for us to know, although I am often active here just to discuss what I know and the rest I Of course looking for unique content on this forum about what I don't know, so it's equally important to learn knowledge wherever it is important that we read it diligently.About crypto is wide I can get knowledge from individuals, on channels, social media and much that I know outside of forums.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on August 29, 2022, 07:45:40 AMBitcointalk is honestly overrated in terms of learning in general. It's great for having questions and discuss/debate certain news and topics, but if you're a beginner you're better off reading articles off the web.I would say that there is lot of quality stuff on the forum but there are many articles directing users towards some misrepresented information over the web as you can't check the authenticity of them but on the contrary the forum will have reliable information source and mistakes being pointed out by high rank and knowledgeable members.There are lot of useful sites also that shares good bitcoin related articles and covers most of the topic but a newbie won't be able to differentiate between them so it's better to go through forum route in my opinion.They can opt for books like Mastering Bitcoin to have the proper knowledge if they want to or as you suggest to them watch Andreas videos on YouTube and plenty of other resources but once they find out the basics they can check for web sources also to find out the legit one.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMI personally like this forum because i get all types of knowledge here. Different different sec section have different information. As a Newbie i want to spend more and more time in this forum to gain more and more information for my intelligence.Yes, here is a veritable place to learn crypto stuff. It may take a while for one to know how to navigate the relevant sections of this forum but once one is settled in, learning becomes enjoyable. I had such experience as a noob and would often get lost locating threads I was reading until I would stumble on them again later. I started my crypto journey here and most of the things I know about cryptos were from this forum.QuoteNow i want to get more and more information how to improve my poor English writing /speaking  Get an online dictionary. Learn how to search for expressions, idioms and collocations you come across so as to get their meanings. That's an easy way to improve on grammar.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMI personally like this forum because i get all types of knowledge here. Different different sec section have different information.You overvalue the forum and I believe we can not get all knowledge here. We can learn a lot in this forum but not all knowledge on Earth is available here.Additionally, spend time and learn something from your time depends on how you spend your time, what you learn, what is your learning method and so on. Most important, if you have good attitude, you can learn and have good practice. So attitude, intention are keys to start your journey.With time, you can adjust your learning method as well as increase your knowledge and skills. You will figure out better ways to learn more effectively and work more productively with a same time budget.

comments.author: GiftedMAN
comments.body: Quote from: Bizoran on August 29, 2022, 07:25:59 AMNow I want to get more and more information on how to improve my poor English writing /speaking  Could this be your notion of joining the forum? I guess no because this is not the right place for learning how to write or speak good English. Satoshi Nakomoto created this forum for discussion, information, and promotion of Bitcoin but you can also get much useful information about other cryptocurrencies hence you are active here but your main reason should be to get knowledge on bitcoin I believe when you focus on reading the threads that has been created here by members of this forum and the once that will be created now that you located here, your writing and speaking pattern will also get better.

comments.author: Bhig Daddy
comments.body: Well alot of knowledge are shared on this forum if I am to be honest, so far it one of the most effective and knowledgeable cryptocurrency forum I have been on. But also you should know that you can't learn hoe to speak English or write either on this forum, this forum is about bitcoin and cryptocurrency as a whole.

This is a forum, learn, ask questions and also contribute and stay here having real life discussion about what would education other members.
